availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George E. Waring, Jr. (New York, engineer and soldier)

body.p: New York, engineer and soldier. Appointed agricultural and drainage engineer for New York Central Park in 1857. Colonel of the 4th Missouri Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) from 1862 to 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, New York, Westchester County, Rye, p. 35. Medico-Legal Society of New York, The Sanitarian, vol. 41 (New York: A. N. Bell, 1898), 559. Annual Report of the Adjutant General of Missouri of 1864 (Jefferson City: W. A. Curry, Public Printer, 1865), 168-173. Annual Report of the Adjutant General of Missouri, For the Year Ending December 31, 1865 (Jefferson City: W. A. Curry, Public Printer, 1866), 335-337. David Schuyler and Gregory Kalliss, eds., The Papers of Frederick Law Olmstead: The Last Great Project, 1890-1895 (Baltimore: John Hopkins University Press, 2015), 138.
Find A Grave, "Col. George E. Waring, Jr. (July 4, 1833-October 29, 1898)," Memorial #120358069, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/120358069 (accessed February 14, 2017).
